member.name: T:JsonFx.Model.Filters.Iso8601DateFilter
member.summary: Defines a filter for JSON-style serialization of DateTime into ISO-8601 string
member.remarks:
This is the format used by EcmaScript 5th edition Date.prototype.toJSON(...): http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-262.pdf http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
NOTE: This format limits expressing DateTime as either UTC or Unspecified. Local (i.e. Server Local) is converted to UTC.

member.summary: Converts a ISO-8601 string to the corresponding DateTime representation

member.summary: Converts a DateTime to the corresponding ISO-8601 string representation

member.summary: Determines the precision of fractional seconds. Defaults to EcmaScript precision of milliseconds.

member.name: T:JsonFx.Model.Filters.Iso8601DateFilter.Precision
member.summary: Defines the precision of fractional seconds in ISO-8601 dates

member.name: T:JsonFx.Model.Filters.MSAjaxDateFilter
member.summary: Defines a filter for JSON-style serialization of DateTime into an ASP.NET Ajax Date string.
member.remarks:
This is the format used by Microsoft ASP.NET Ajax: http://weblogs.asp.net/bleroy/archive/2008/01/18/dates-and-json.aspx
NOTE: This format is limited to expressing DateTime at the millisecond level as UTC only. The WCF extension of adding a timezone is ignored as this returns UTC dates only.

member.name: T:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy
member.summary: Defines a prioritized taxonomy of tags
member.remarks: The types are enumerated in ascending levels of risk for use in filtering HTML input

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Text
member.summary: Literal text, no tags

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Inline
member.summary: Inline character level elements and text strings
member.remarks: Tags of this type typically do not disrupt the text flow

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Style
member.summary: style elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type change the visual appearance of text

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.List
member.summary: list elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type denote lists and typically change the text flow

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Block
member.summary: Block-level elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type denote sections or change the text flow

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Media
member.summary: Media elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type safely embed media content

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Table
member.summary: Tabular elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type have a very specific structure and their own rendering model

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Form
member.summary: Form elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type are used in the construction of forms for capturing user input

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Script
member.summary: Script elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type represent a security risk to the containing document but must obey the browser security sandbox

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Document
member.summary: Document elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type are used to construct the document itself

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Plugin
member.summary: embedded elements
member.remarks: Tags of this type represent a large security risk to the containing document as plug-ins may circumvent the browser security sandbox

member.name: F:JsonFx.Html.HtmlTaxonomy.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown elements

member.name: M:JsonFx.Html.HtmlFormatter.WriteLocalName(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Emits a valid XML local-name (i.e. encodes invalid chars including ':')
member.remarks: Explicitly escaping ':' to maintain compatibility with XML Namespaces. From XML 1.0, 5th ed. http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-common-syn Name = NameStartChar (NameChar)* NameStartChar = ":" | [A-Z] | "_" | [a-z] | [#xC0-#xD6] | [#xD8-#xF6] | [#xF8-#x2FF] | [#x370-#x37D] | [#x37F-#x1FFF] | [#x200C-#x200D] | [#x2070-#x218F] | [#x2C00-#x2FEF] | [#x3001-#xD7FF] | [#xF900-#xFDCF] | [#xFDF0-#xFFFD] | [#x10000-#xEFFFF] NameChar = NameStartChar | "-" | "." | [0-9] | #xB7 | [#x0300-#x036F] | [#x203F-#x2040]

member.name: M:JsonFx.Markup.MarkupGrammar.TokenUnparsed(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Any of a number of unparsed tags which typically contain specialized processing instructions
member.remarks:
The name of the token is the beginning and ending delimiters as a format string (not including the '<' or '>') Includes the following types:
"<!--", "-->" XML/HTML/SGML comment "<!", ">" XML/SGML declaration (e.g. DOCTYPE or server-side includes)
"<?=", "?>" PHP expression "<?", "?>" PHP code block /XML processing instruction (e.g. the XML declaration)
"<%--", "--%>" ASP/PSP/JSP-style code comment "<%@", "%>" ASP/PSP/JSP directive "<%=", "%>" ASP/PSP/JSP/JBST expression "<%!", "%>" JSP/JBST declaration "<%#", "%>" ASP.NET/JBST databind expression "<%$", "%>" ASP.NET/JBST extension "<%", "%>" ASP code block / JSP scriptlet / PSP code block

member.summary: Represents a property or document name, and a corresponding namespace URI (or empty string). Analogous to XML "expanded name": http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/#dt-expname
member.remarks: Namespaces must be a URI, but local-name can be any non-null string. It is up to formatters to determine how to properly represent names which are invalid for the format.

member.name: M:JsonFx.Serialization.DataName.CompareTo(JsonFx.Serialization.DataName)
member.summary: Compares two values and returns an indication of their relative sort order.
member.remarks: Performs ordering according to XML Canonicalization document order http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-c14n#DocumentOrder "An element's namespace nodes are sorted lexicographically by local name (the default namespace node, if one exists, has no local name and is therefore lexicographically least)." "An element's attribute nodes are sorted lexicographically with namespace URI as the primary key and local name as the secondary key (an empty namespace URI is lexicographically least)."

member.name: T:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy
member.summary: Controls name resolution for IDataReader / IDataWriter using attributes and conventions similar to XmlSerializer semantics
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/83y7df3e.aspx

member.name: M:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy.IsPropertyIgnored(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the property is to be serialized.
member.remarks: default implementation is must be read/write properties, or immutable

member.name: M:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy.IsFieldIgnored(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the field is to be serialized.
member.remarks: default implementation is must be public, non-readonly field

member.name: M:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy.GetValueIgnoredCallback(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Gets a delegate which determines if the property or field should not be serialized based upon its value.
member.returns: if has a value equivalent to the DefaultValueAttribute or has a property named XXXSpecified which determines visibility
member.remarks: This is useful when default values need not be serialized. Under these situations XmlSerializer ignores properties based upon value: - DefaultValue: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.componentmodel.defaultvalueattribute.aspx - Specified Properies: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb402199.aspx - ShouldSerialize Methods: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/53b8022e.aspx

member.name: M:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy.GetName(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Gets the serialized name for the member.

member.name: M:JsonFx.Xml.Resolvers.XmlResolverStrategy.SortMembers(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JsonFx.Serialization.Resolvers.MemberMap})
member.summary: Sorts members to ensure proper document order where attributes precede all child elements.
member.remarks: Performs the first stage of XML Canonicalization document order http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-c14n#DocumentOrder "An element's namespace and attribute nodes have a document order position greater than the element but less than any child node of the element."

member.name: T:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator
member.summary: Generates delegates for getting/setting properties and field and invoking constructors

member.summary: Creates a field getter delegate for the specified property or field
member.returns: GetterDelegate for property or field, null otherwise
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetSetter(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Creates a field setter delegate for the specified property or field
member.returns: SetterDelegate for property or field, null otherwise

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetPropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a property getter delegate for the specified property
member.returns: GetterDelegate if property CanRead, otherwise null
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetPropertySetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a property setter delegate for the specified property
member.returns: GetterDelegate if property CanWrite, otherwise null
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetFieldGetter(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Creates a field getter delegate for the specified field
member.returns: GetterDelegate which returns field unless is enum in which will return enum value
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetFieldSetter(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Creates a field setter delegate for the specified field
member.returns: SetterDelegate unless field IsInitOnly then returns null
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.name: M:JsonFx.CodeGen.DynamicMethodGenerator.GetMethodProxy(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Creates a proxy delegate accepting a target instance and corresponding arguments
member.returns: ProxyDelegate or null if cannot be invoked
member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected methods without safety checks.

member.summary: Creates a default constructor delegate

member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.summary: Creates a constructor delegate accepting specified arguments

member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.

member.remarks: Note: use with caution this method will expose private and protected constructors without safety checks.
